name: plugin-template
description: A comprehensive template demonstrating all Claude Code plugin features

metadata_fields.author: Object with name, email, url fields

component_paths.commands: Path to commands directory (optional, auto-discovered from ./commands)
component_paths.agents: Path to agents directory (optional, auto-discovered from ./agents)
component_paths.skills: Path to skills directory (optional, auto-discovered from ./skills)
component_paths.hooks: Path to hooks.json file or inline object (optional)
component_paths.mcpServers: Path to .mcp.json file or inline object (optional)

auto_discovery.note: Components are auto-discovered from default directories even without explicit paths
auto_discovery.hooks: Not auto-discovered - must be specified in plugin.json or separate file
auto_discovery.mcpServers: Not auto-discovered - must be specified in plugin.json or separate file

component_definitions.commands: Defined in Markdown files (commands/*.md), NOT in plugin.json
component_definitions.agents: Defined in Markdown files (agents/*.md), NOT in plugin.json
component_definitions.skills: Defined in directories with SKILL.md (skills/*/SKILL.md), NOT in plugin.json
component_definitions.hooks: Defined in hooks.json or inline in this file
component_definitions.mcpServers: Defined in .mcp.json or inline in this file

common_mistakes: Putting agent/skill/command definitions in plugin.json (they go in Markdown files)
Using Node.js fields like 'main', 'engines', 'dependencies' (not used by Claude Code)
Placing component directories inside .claude-plugin/ (they go at plugin root)
Using absolute paths (always use relative paths starting with ./)
Not understanding that component paths are optional (auto-discovery works without them)
template_instructions: 2. Update metadata fields (version, description, author, etc.)
4. Component paths are optional - remove if using default locations
6. Component directories must be at plugin root, not in .claude-plugin/
